alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; Snowy Range; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 1:50AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A snow squall will impact portions of southern Albany and western Laramie Counties through 315 AM MST... At 148 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a heavy burst of snow along a line extending from 8 miles south of Baldy Peak to University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium to near Woods Landing. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Rapid reduction in visibility to 1/4 mile or less with blowing snow. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous travel conditions. Locations impacted include... Laramie, Albany, Bosler, Federal, Tie Siding, Woods Landing-Jelm, Pumpkin Vine, Vedauwoo Campground, North Crow Campground, Iron Mountain, Granite Springs Campground, Horse Creek, The Buttes, Lake Owen, Hutton Lake, Yellow Pine Campground, Tie City Campground, Vedauwoo, University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium and Crystal Lake Reservoir. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 295 and 349. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapidly changing conditions with falling and blowing snow along portions of Interstate 80.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; Snowy Range; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
